item.title: Alan Wake 2: The Lake House Expansion Gets Teaser Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/alan-wake-2-the-lake-house-expansion-gets-teaser-trailer/

The expansion Alan Wake 2: The Lake House was unveiled today during the September 2024 State of Play. Fans got a first look at the upcoming expansion in a trailer released by Remedy. Fans already expected this expansion to be released sometime in October, and this was confirmed once again, albeit with no specific date. Furthermore, a more detailed synopsis for fans to dive into. While the trailer didn't expose too many details, it became obvious that the story centered around the Federal Bureau of Control, with the station being set inside the Lake House.

Instead of playing as Alan Wake, this time, you'll be playing as Kiran Estevez, an FBC agent, as the story takes place parallel to the main game.

Alan Wake 2: The Lake House is clearly linked to Remedy's other major franchise, Control, as part of the so-called Remedy Connected Universe (which will now be expanded into film and television following the deal with Annapurna Pictures).

The previous Alan Wake 2 DLC, Night Springs, featured three episodes with three different protagonists, one of whom was Control's main character, Jesse Faden. Reviewer Francesco De Meo rated it 8.5 out of 10:

While it does not offer much in terms of gameplay, the Alan Wake 2: Night Springs expansion is a worthy DLC to experience for all fans of the base game and Remedy Entertainment's titles. Free from the limitations imposed by the base game's narrative, which was fairly loose to begin with, Sam Lake and his team have gone all out to provide some extremely entertaining scenarios that, unfortunately, are over way too soon and leave the player wanting more. Hopefully, the next expansion, Lake House, will offer something a bit meatier to complement the masterful storytelling that is as well showcased in Night Springs as it is in the base game.

AMEDAMA coming to PS5 on November 21
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/09/amedama-coming-to-ps5-on-november-21
  • PS5

PlayStation 5 version due out alongside Switch version.

Publisher and developer IzanagiGames, and developer ACQUIRE will release a PlayStation 5 version of side-scrolling, soul-shifting sandbox action adventure game AMEDAMA alongside the previously announced Switch version on November 21. Wishlisting is available now via PlayStation Store.

AMEDAMA first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on March 22, followed by a full release on September 12.

Here is an overview of the game, via IzanagiGames:

About

Yushin and his sister Yui run the local umbrella shop. One evening, as rain falls outside, a group of men burst in, killing Yushin before Yui’s eyes. With nothing but his soul remaining, Yushin must fight tooth and nail, possessing any body he can on the quest to find his sister and uncover the truth behind her disappearance. With only seven days left before his soul fades away, can he save her in time? Transport yourself to feudal Japan in the last years of the Edo period, and experience a tale of rain and reincarnation, brought to life with striking new 2D visuals.

Story

Aihama, Japan. The final years of the Edo period. One rain-drenched evening, a group of men burst into the town’s brother and sister-run umbrella shop. Yushin is cut down in front of his sister Yui, leaving her alone in the world. The next thing he knows, he is looking down at his own stricken corpse—a soul without a body. The grim incident shatters the peace in this quiet backwater. Lurking beneath the surface is an intricate, deep-rooted plot, shrouded in mystery. Until Yui is safe, not even death is enough to extinguish Yushin’s soul. He’ll stop at nothing on his quest, shifting from body to body, possessing anyone and anything to rescue his sister. But with just seven days before his soul departs this world—can he save Yui in time?

This is a tale of rain, reincarnation, and revenge.

Key Features

  • Soul-Shifting Showdowns – Lacking a physical form, you’ll need to shift your soul to other bodies on the quest to find your sister. Possession puts you in complete control of whoever and whatever you inhabit, giving you access to a variety of weapons and fighting styles. Depending on your current body, you’ll face different foes and encounter new faces on your incorporeal journey.
  • Inclement Intrigue – This human drama plays out against the rain-soaked backdrop of mid 19th century Japan, rendered in an evocative pixel style. In the sombre world of AMEDAMA, beauty and darkness are two sides of the same coin.
  • Reincarnation, Repercussions – As you relive the same seven day period over and over again, your choices will impact the story unfolding around you. Who will you speak to? How will you intervene? The decisions, and the outcomes, are all up to you.
  • Counteraction Using the Sword Technique of Usetsu Tensei Sword Style – Where Yushin, having mastered the key to battles, employs the technique known as ‘Misty Riposte.’ By countering the opponent’s attacks, significant damage is dealt in a counteraction.

Staff

  • Development / Marketing: IzanagiGames
  • Planning: Acquire
  • Character Design: lack (Fate/Grand Order, Touken Ranbu)
  • Soundtrack: Yuko Komiyama (Monster Hunter series)

item.title: Cladun X3 announced for PS5, PS4, and Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/09/cladun-x3-announced-for-ps5-ps4-and-switch

Get the first details below.

■ Specifications

  • Title: Cladun X3
  • Genre: Pixel art action RPG with endless freedom
  • Platforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch
  • Release Date: February 27, 2025
  • Players: One
  • Price: 7,200 yen (7,920 yen with tax)
  • Publisher: Nippon Ichi Software
  • Head of Development: Shinichi Ikeda
  • Illustrator: Mota
  • CERO Rating: A (all ages)
  • Official Website: nippon1.jp
  • Official Hashtag: #クラダン, #クラダンX3

■ Story

Arcanus Cella—a miniature world that connects that various worlds, dungeons, and eras.

This place, which has existed since ancient times, is said to be accessible only to chosen villains.

Today, a new villain has once again been summoned to Arcanus Cella…

■ System

● To Become the Strongest, Challenge the Dungeons that Await in Arcanus Cella

One day, you are suddenly brought to Arcanus Cella, joining many other villains. Upon arriving, you and the others are told that you must play a death game for the sake of “world peace.”

To survive this dangerous death game, you must grow stronger. Train, gather items, and venture into the mysterious dungeon connected to Arcanus Cella in order to become the strongest villain.

Cladun X3 is a highly customizable and dynamic pixel art action RPG with a focus on hack-and-slash gameplay. Utilize a variety of weapons, magic, and actions to fend off the monsters monsters and traps that await you, and clear the dungeons!

● Utilize Various Weapons and Actions to Overcome Vicious Monsters and Dangerous Traps

The dungeons are teeming with vicious monsters and brimming with dangerous traps.

Monsters will attack you in real-time in the dungeons. Utilize a range of actions—attack, magic, dashing, jumping, sliding, defending with a shield, flying, and shifting—to swiftly and precisely defeat monsters and progress through the dungeon.

—How you choose to fight is up to you: deploy a magical barrier to nullify damage, or leap into fire to set yourself ablaze and deal heavy damage to ice-type monsters.

There are six equippable weapon types: sword, blunt weapon, staff, spear, bow, and dagger. Each weapon has its own specialties in terms of attack range and abilities, with skills that vary depending on your class.

—Blunt weapons can be used to destroy certain walls in dungeons, while the staff enables mid-to-long range attribute attacks and speeds up casting times. Each weapon type has unique actions that can be used to navigate the dungeon.

Various actions can also be used to bypass traps, such as sliding under laser beams, jumping over floor traps, or using charging enemies to destroy walls. The key to clearing dungeons is instantly determining the right action to proceed safely.

—Traps can be dodged by sliding or flying, but they can also be skillfully utilized to defeat enemies in one fell swoop.

You will find various equipment and items in the dungeon. Search for treasure chests to acquire powerful weapons and equipment to strengthen your character.

—Even equipment with the same name may have different quality levels or special effects due to titles attached to them.

● Classes

In Cladun X3, you can choose from 10 different classes. Each class has different stats, preferred weapons, and “Magic Circles” that they can learn.

Warrior

  • An all-purpose and easy-to-use class recommended for beginners.
  • Can learn sword, blunt weapon, and spear skills.
  • Specializes in close-range attacks.
  • Can learn many of the simple Magic Circles from previous entries in the series.

Wizard

  • A magic class recommended for beginners.
  • Can learn attack magic and specializes in long-range attacks.
  • Can learn many Magic Circles focused on buffing skills and magic.
  • Can suppress Sorcery Outbursts.

Ranger

  • A class recommended for intermediate to advanced players.
  • Can learn bow and dagger skills, as well as support magic.
  • Excels at traversing sticky terrain, grasslands, and fiery terrain.
  • Can learn Magic Circles that offer adaptable performance, such as changing stats or switching weapons based on certain terrain.

Merchant

  • A tricky class recommended for intermediate to advanced players.
  • Can learn job skills focused on money, such as those to “retain money even when defeated” and “attract money scattered around the map.”
  • Can learn Magic Circles that instantly increases stats while money is scattered around the map.

● Set Up Your Party and Power Them Up! Magic Circles are the Key to Character Development

Magic Circles are a unique party formation system from the Cladun series, enabling a party of multiple characters to function in an action RPG where the player only controls one character.

The player-controlled character—the “main character”—is positioned at the center, while the “sub characters” placed around them provide support and boost their power.

—Placing special items in the Magic Circle activates the sub characters, allowing you to enhance the main character as much as you like.

There are over 200 types of Magic Circles, with some being four times larger than those in previous entries. Certain Magic Circles can support a party of up to 16 characters. New effect spaces have also been added, expanding the variety of power-up combinations.

In battle, sub characters in the Magic Circle act as shields, absorbing damage in place of the main character. As long as the sub characters stay alive, the main character won’t take any damage.

New Magic Circles are learned each time you level up, and the Magic Circles learned differ based on your class. For example, a wizard will learn Magic Circles that specialize in using magic, while a Merchant will learn Magic Circles that allows them to use money.

● Formidable Foes and Treasures Await in the Ever-Changing Random Dungeons (Ran-geons)

The Ran-geon is a 100-level random dungeon separate from the main story dungeons.

Each time you enter the Ran-geon, its layout changes. You’ll need to find either the “gate” to the next level or the “exit” to escape.

Every time you pass through one of the five randomly appearing gates, the monster levels increase, and elements like item drop rates are randomly changed.

If luck is on your side, you will enter a fever state, where items drop with every defeated enemy. But if you are unlucky, monster levels could exceed 1,000, turning your search for the exit into a nightmare…

Try out Ran-geons when you get stuck in the main story and need to level up, or want to dig up rare items to become stronger, or when you want to take on a challenge where life and death is on the line.

—Depending on the gate you enter, all of the enemies may become suddenly stronger, or your HP and SP may fully recover, making this dungeon a fun gamble. If you are not careful, you could be wiped out entirely!

Additionally, Cladun X3 offers a new type of Ran-geon called “Map-geons,” which can be generated using the “Magic Map.” Magic Maps can be obtained randomly by clearing the lowest level of a Map-geon, and can be shared with other players through the network.

● Challenge Dungeons with Your Own Customized Character

In Cladun X3, the main character that the player controls, as well as the sub characters that form your party, and the graphics for the characters’ weapons and armor can all be customized by the player, allowing you to challenge dungeons with characters all your own.

—Players can fully customize their characters’ appearance using pixel art.

—Use the “draw” tool to create original weapons and armor. With the introduction of flying in this game, you can now also draw wings.

—Your lovingly crafted customized characters will fight and explore as you play.

—The weapons they use and magic they learn is up to you.

—You can even recreate your favorite characters in the game.

The customization does not stop at character creation. Cladun X3 offers an enhanced music editor that allows you to create original background music. Since pink noise is also supported, you can also create rhythm instruments and sound effects. Tone definition, envelope definition, and macros are also supported, allowing you to create an even wider range of music.

—The possibilities are endless, like creating a theme song for your customized character.

● Share Your Custom Characters and Maps With Other Players<?strong>

With the new “network” function, you can create a town map that matches your custom characters and share it with other players. Not only can you create your own town graphics on the town map, you can play your own background music, place characters, and create the world to your heart’s content. After you have created your city map, be sure to share it with other players!

By creating and sharing a town map, other players can explore it and receive the Magic Map you have placed. By exchanging Magic Maps with everyone, you may be able to encounter a rare dungeon that you would never see by playing the game alone.

—Even players who choose not to create maps can enjoy exploring maps created by other players and collecting Magic Maps in “Auto Mode.”

In the Switch version, touch controls are supported for some features like the draw tool and map editing, allowing players to enjoy drawing even without the use of a controller.

■ Box Art

■ Playable at Tokyo Game Show 2024

A demo of Cladun X3 will be playable at Tokyo Game Show 2024 from September 26 to 29 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan. Players will be able to use various weapons and action to clear the Ran-geon exclusive to Tokyo Game Show 2024, which is filled with vicious monsters and dangerous traps.

Players will be able to use the following Nippon Ichi Software customized character appearances while playing:

  • Disgaea – Laharl, Flonne, Etna
  • Disgaea 2 – Asagi
  • Disgaea 4 – Valvatorez, Desco
  • Disgaea 5 – Killia
  • Disgaea 7 – Fuji, Pirilika
  • Disgaea Series – Prinny (two types), Archer
  • Rhapsody: A Musical Adventure – Cornet
  • Soul Nomad & the World Eaters – Gig
  • Cladun: This is an RPG – Despina
  • Blue Roses: The Fairy and Blue Eyed Warriors – Alicia, Roche
  • The Witch and the Hundred Knight – Metallia, Visco, Nezaria, Hundred Knight
  • Battle Princess of Arcadias – Plume, Uni, Larts
  • htoL#NiQ: The Firefly Diary – Mion
  • Yomawari – Little Girl, Spirit
  • Criminal Girls 2: Party Favors – Chloe, Shinoa, Tsukasa
  • A Rose in the Twilight – Rose
  • The Liar Princess and the Blind Prince – Princess
  • Lapis x Labyrinth – Maid
  • void* tRrLM2(); //Void Terrarium 2 – Toriko, Robot
  • Xicatrice – Shiduru Nagamiya
  • Bar Stella Abyss – Wanderer
  • Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero – Marona

New demo playable at Tokyo Game Show 2024.

Publisher Chorus Worldwide and developer Indie-us Games have released the Tokyo Game Show 2024 trailer for open-world superhero action adventure game UNDEFEATED: Genesis.

A new demo of UNDEFEATED: Genesis will be playable at Tokyo Game Show 2024, which will run from September 26 to 29 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via Chorus Worldwide:

UNDEFEATED: Genesis is a superhero action game set on a massive alien planet.

Developed in Unreal Engine 5, the game builds on UNDEFEATED and the feeling of being a superhero, but is vastly scaled up in scope, technology, and story. In UNDEFEATED: Genesis, players will experience flying across a huge environment, developing and using astounding superpowers, and experiencing a rich storyline.

The game is being developed with the intention of delivering a true “superhero experience” to fans and aims to make players feel the same sense of power as heroes in comics and manga.

UNDEFEATED: Genesis takes place in the same universe as UNDEFEATED and narratively serves as its prequel.

UNDEFEATED: Genesis is due out for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam in 2026.

item.title: HITMAN World of Assassination coming to PS VR2 in December
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/09/hitman-world-of-assassination-coming-to-ps-vr2-in-december
  • PS VR2
  • PS5

Includes dual-wielding, full ambidexterity, room-scale implementation, and more.

Io Interactive will release HITMAN World of Assassination for PlayStation VR2 in December, the company announced.

The PlayStation VR2 version of HITMAN World of Assassination will feature brand-new virtual reality features, including dual-wielding, full ambidexterity, room-scale implementation, as well as general improved virtual reality experience through new intuitive controls and gameplay mechanics.

Users who own the PlayStation 5 version of HITMAN World of Assassination will be able to access the PlayStation VR2 version through an upgrade pack for $9.99 / €9.99 / £8.99.

Here is an overview of the PlayStation VR2 version, via IO Interactive:

HITMAN World of Assassination on PlayStation VR2 will support the full main campaign of HITMAN World of Assassination, allowing players to enjoy the award-winning game with added immersion and brand-new additions. Become the world’s best assassin through the 4K HDR display of PlayStation VR2. Explore your surroundings, create unique strategies using the environment, disguise yourself to blend in the crowd, and strike when the timing is right, all through Agent 47’s eyes.

HITMAN World of Assassination on PlayStation VR2 has been enhanced to completely immerse players during their missions. Now supporting dual-wielding, a wide array of actions and interactions have been added, including the possibility of performing actions with both controllers at the same time, active reloading, on-body weapon holstering, aiming through the sniper’s scope, and manual interactions to take disguises. Enhancements have been added to improve the core VR experience, such as room-scale implementation, spatial interactions to touch, grab, and position, integration of the PlayStation VR2 controllers’ adaptative triggers, and many more.

item.title: Limited-Edition Fortnite DualSense Controller Revealed Alongside PS5's New Chroma Line
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-ps5-dualsense-controller-state-of-play-2024/1100-6526685/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PlayStation unveiled multiple new controllers and PS5 console covers during the latest State of Play presentation. Most notably, Fortnite is getting its own limited-edition DualSense on November 7. It has a blue color scheme and graffiti-style decals inspired by the game. PlayStation also unveiled its new Chroma Collection, which gives three DualSense colors and matching console covers a flashy chrome finish.

The Fortnite controller certainly stands out with a chaotic design that's the complete opposite of the recently released Astro Bot controller (sold out). Nevertheless, it's a limited-edition DualSense controller themed around Fortnite, so it will likely sell out fast when preorders go live October 3.

Aside from the Fortnite theming, the controller is otherwise the same as other standard DualSense controllers, complete with features like haptic feedback, dynamic triggers, touchpad, and gyro controls. PlayStation recently raised the price of DualSense controllers by five bucks, and the Fortnite controller reflects this change with an $85 list price. The Astro Bot controller only costs $80 (if you can find it), probably because preorders were already available when the increase went into effect. Going forward, limited-edition DualSense controllers will likely cost $85.

More Fortnite controllers

  • PowerA OPS V1 Wireless Controller - Fortnite Edition (PC, Mobile) -- $55
  • PowerA Enhanced Wireless Controller - Peely Edition (Switch)-- $65
  • PowerA Wireless Xbox Controller - Fortnite Special Edition (Xbox, PC, Mobile)-- $100 | Releases October 1

If you're interested in the Fortnite DualSense controller but aren't able to get one when preorders go live, there are new and upcoming third-party wireless gamepads with official Fortnite themes for Xbox, Nintendo Switch, and PC. Two of them also happen to have very busy designs.

Despite its bright yellow design, the Peely-themed wireless Switch controller by PowerA is the most understated of the bunch. It connects wirelessly via Bluetooth and has a pair of remappable back buttons. The Peely controller released earlier this year for $65 and comes with a code for the Prickly Axe skin.

Xbox and PC users can preorder PowerA's pro-style Fortnite controller for $100 ahead of its October 1 release. This limited-edition controller, which is on the left side of the above image, has a range of customizable features, including Hall Effect sticks and triggers, four remappable back buttons, trigger locks, and custom profiles. It comes bundled with the Tooth Pickaxe skin. This controller has very similar features as the recently launched PowerA OPS V3 Pro for PC, which we found to be quite impressive for the price.

The more budget-friendly controller in the OPS line, the V1, has a Fortnite-themed edition for $55. A wireless controller for PC and mobile, the Fortnite Edition OPS V1 is equipped with Hall Effect sticks and triggers, four remappable back buttons, and three-way trigger locks. You can connect wirelessly via 2.4GHz or Bluetooth. It's available now at Amazon and comes with the Assault Bomber glider skin.

Chroma Collection DualSense Controllers and PS5 Console Covers

PlayStation's new Chroma Collection goes up for preorder October 3 at 7 AM PT / 10 AM ET. The trio of PS5 controllers and console covers come in three iridescent color options: Chroma Pearl, Chroma Indigo, and Chroma Teal.

Chroma controllers retail for the new $80 price. Console covers for the PS5 Slim cost $65 each, five bucks more than than existing color options. Chroma Pearl and Indigo accessories release November 7, but Chroma Teal won't be available until January 23, 2025.

November will be a busy month for PlayStation gear, as the PS5 Pro is also slated for a November 7 launch. Preorders for the PS5 Pro go live September 26 on PlayStation Direct and October 10 at major retailers. Two weeks after the PS5 Pro's launch, PlayStation's 30th Anniversary Collection will bring limited-edition consoles and controllers. All of the gear will likely sell out fast when the collection launches November 21.

If you're looking for PS5 controller recommendations beyond the DualSense controller, check out our list of the best PS5 controllers, including the modular Victrix Pro BFG, which now has a Tekken edition and will soon be available with a new Call of Duty-themed design. The Call of Duty Field Op edition can be preordered at Amazon ahead of its October 25 launch, the same day as Black Ops 6.

item.title: Ghost of Tsushima Sequel, Ghost of Yotei, Announced With New Protagonist and Story Set 300 Years After Original - State of Play
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/ghost-of-tsushima-2-confirmed-as-ghost-of-yotei-at-state-of-play-releasing-2025

We got the first look during today's livestream.

Ghost of Tsushima is officially getting a sequel titled Ghost of Yotei, it was confirmed during today's Sony State of Play presentation. It'll arrive sometime in 2025.

It was the big announcement to close out the State of Play, and one of the biggest surprises. Developer Sucker Punch showed off a significant look at footage too, including some gorgeous cinematics. And if you couldn't glean from the title, it'll focus on a different setting and a brand-new protagonist, Atsu, moving away from Ghost of Tsushima's Jin Sakai.

Sucker Puncher didn't reveal too much during the presentation, but we got a little more insight thanks to a PlayStation blog post shortly after. It'll take place in 1603, 300 years after the events of Ghost of Tsushima, in the lands surrounding Mount Yōtei, known as Hokkaido today. Sucker Punch calls it "a far cry from the organized samurai clans who lived in Tsushima, and it’s the setting for an original story we can’t wait to tell."

According to the post, the developer "wanted to maintain the core pillars established in Ghost of Tsushima: playing as a wandering warrior in Feudal Japan, offering freedom to explore at your own pace, and highlighting the beauty of the world."

"We also wanted to continue to innovate. To create something fresh but familiar, we looked beyond Jin Sakai’s story and the island of Tsushima, and shifted our focus to the idea of the Ghost instead," the post continues. "At Sucker Punch we love origin stories, and we wanted to explore what it could mean to have a new hero wearing a Ghost mask, and uncovering a new legend. This led us to Ghost of Yōtei: a new protagonist, a new story to unfold, and a new region of Japan to explore."

As "Sucker Punch’s first game built from the ground up for PlayStation 5," it'll also include new mechanics, gameplay improvements, and new weapons.

Unabashedly inspired by the works of Akira Kurosawa (to the point where the game even included a "Kurosawa Mode") and other samurai films, Ghost of Tsushima followed a samurai on a quest to protect Tsushima Island during the first Mongol invasion of Japan. It released for the PlayStation 4 in July 2020 followed by a multiplayer mode, Ghost of Tsushima: Legends, that October. A Director's Cut was released for PS4 and PS5 in 2021, and a PC port finally arrived last year.

A Ghost of Tsushima movie is also in the works with Sony Pictures and PlayStation Productions, with John Wick director Chad Stahelski set to direct.

IGN gave Ghost of Tsushima a 9/10 back in 2020, calling it "an absolutely gorgeous adventure through one of history’s most strikingly beautiful landscapes, and that beauty is compounded by one of the best blade-to-blade combat systems the open-world action genre has seen."

Ghost of Yotei Screenshots - State of Play September 2024

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Release Date Revealed During State of Play; New Monsters Shown In Story Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/monster-hunter-wilds-release-date-revealed-during-state-of-play-new-monsters-shown-in-story-trailer

A new generation of monster hunting begins next February.

During the Sony's September 2024 State of Play livestream, Capcom showed a new story trailer for Monster Hunter Wilds. But the big news was the reveal of the game's launch date: the Monster Hunter Wilds release date is February 28, 2025, and it'll be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC.

We recently played a preview build of the game, and came away impressed with Monster Hunter Wilds, but you can watch the new trailer below. And further details on Monster Hunter Wilds were given on PlayStation blog. Arkveld is the flagship monster for this entry and comes from a long-extinct species, and the mystery of its existence is at the heart of the story. In the Forbidden Lands, where Wilds takes place, a research team investigates attacks by a monster they call the "White Wraith" and follow clues from a boy they saved named Nata. Arkveld is a beastly figure with massive chain-like wings it uses to attack.

From here, you form units within the Hunter's Guild. You as the protagonist belong to the Avis Unit and the characters featured in the trailer - Olivia the hunter, Erik the biologist, and Werner the engineer - belong to the Astrum Unit. And it seems that this is the lens for which you experience Monster Hunters Wilds' story.

The Scarlet Forest was shown in previous trailers but this latest one gave a closer look at its lucious environments where you'll be fishing, scaling cliffs, and hunting monsters, of course. Using a hookshot-like Slinger can lead to contextual environmental destruction which can be a key part of battles. The Slinger can also whip you around the world as a means of traversal, along with a pet Seikret mount.

item.title: Palworld PS5 Appears at State of Play Against Backdrop of Pokemon Lawsuit
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/palworld-ps5-appears-at-state-of-play-against-backdrop-of-pokemon-lawsuit

Just days after Nintendo sued developer Pocketpair for alleged patent infringement, Pokemon-with-guns game Palworld has appeared at Sony's State of Play in a surprising shadow drop: the game is out on PS5 at last, starting today.

The monster battling adventure materialized during the State of Play today featuring a player character cheekily designed to look rather like Horizon: Zero Dawn's Aloy, complete with a team of pals.

We didn't really see any new game details in the trailer, but it concluded with the message that the game is out today on PS5.

Palworld's release on PS5 comes just after the news that Nintendo and The Pokemon Company are filing a lawsuit against developer Pocketpair, alleging that Palworld infringes on multiple of their owned patent rights. While fans had speculated for months that the company would take Pocketpair to court, speculation largely revolved around the similarities of some of Palworld's monster designs to Pokemon's. The actual lawsuit, however, revolves around patented game mechanics, leaving many puzzled as to how it may actually play out in Japanese courts.

Palworld launched in early access in January this year on PC and Xbox as a day-one Game Pass title. We gave its early access launch an 8/10, saying that it "may crib quite a bit from Pokémon’s homework, but deep survival mechanics and a hilarious attitude make it hard to put down – even in Early Access."

You can catch up with everything announced in today's State of Play right here.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

item.title: Ghost of Yōtei: The acclaimed Ghost of Tsushima is getting a sequel
item.content:encoded:
https://arstechnica.com/?p=2052227

Open-World Action Games —

The follow-up to one of our favorite open-world games is coming soon, Sony says.

If you've been sleeping on the Akira Kurosawa-inspired, Assassin's Creed-esque samurai game Ghost of Tsushima, you've been missing out. Given that it recently got a PC release, this is a great time to catch up on it—but now there's even more reason to do so, as Sony just announced a sequel titled Ghost of Yōtei.

Slated for a 2025 release, the game bears similarities to its predecessor. It follows a wandering samurai who rides horses across picturesque, wind-swept fields, befriends animals, and defeats enemies in katana duels.

Whereas Ghost of Tsushima was set on Tsushima Island during the time of the Mongol invasion, Ghost of Yotei is (fittingly) set around the foot of Mount Yōtei, one of Japan's most picturesque locales—the area is called Hokkaido today.

Most fans of the first game expected a new location in Tsushima's sequel, but they may not have expected the other big change: there appears to be a new protagonist. The woman who appears in the trailers is not Jin Sakai, the main character of Tsushima. This suggests the franchise will move forward with something like an anthology format instead of direct sequels. A blog post from Sony says the new character is named Atsu.

The blog post also says that Yōtei takes place in 1603, 300 years after the events of Tsushima.

Developer Sucker Punch hasn't revealed anything about the gameplay, though, beyond what we see in the trailer. So far, what we see looks almost identical to what we've played before. There are surely going to be more announcements to come, though.

item.content:encoded:

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Near the end of December, Keanu Reeves will lend his voice to Shadow the Hedgehog on the big screen in Sonic the Hedgehog 3. But as revealed during Sony's State of Play, Reeves will also be voicing Shadow earlier in December as part of a DLC release for Sonic x Shadow Generations.

Only a brief clip of the Sonic the Hedgehog 3 Movie Pack DLC was shown during State of Play, but it dropped Reeves' Shadow directly into Tokyo, which is one of the settings in the film.

While speaking to PlayStation Blog, Shun Nakamura noted that the Sonic the Hedgehog 3 Movie pack is unconnected to the narrative of Shadow Generations. Instead, he described it as "bonus content," but stressed that Shadow's controls will remain consistent with the main game.

"The development team also lives in Tokyo, so we tried to develop this setting an enjoyable place as a Sonic game but also clearly showing the Tokyo-likeness," added Nakamura. "We even went out for research to the actual area being used in the game for inspiration. We feel it is very exciting to play as Shadow in a real existing city, so please look forward to it."

Sonic x Shadow Generations is coming to all consoles and PC on October 25, while the Sonic the Hedgehog 3 Movie Pack will be released on December 12. The DLC will also be available as part of the Sonic x Shadow Generations Digital Deluxe Edition.

item.title: Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered Launching This October on PC and PS5
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/horizon-zero-dawn-remastered-launching-this-october-on-pc-and-ps5/

It's no surprise whatsoever that Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered was going to be announced, and as expected, it was announced today during the State of Play. The remaster will be available on PlayStation 5 and PC, with the game launching on 31 October 2024. Those who already own the original PlayStation 4 title will be able to get an upgrade for $9.99.

At the moment, Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered isn't listed on the Steam store, despite the release date of the game being so close.

Compared to The Last of Us remasters, there seems to be more substance to this update. While the main focus is that the graphics have been updated to match Forbidden West, over ten hours of dialogue has been re-recorded. In addition, facial animations have been improved to provide an extra element of realism.

It's not surprising at all that this game was getting a remaster, as just last week, Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered was rated by the ESRB, giving away the fact that the game's remaster was going to be released on PC and PlayStation 5.

Horizon's franchise continues to grow, as Horizon is also getting a LEGO game in the near future, where players will get to explore the expansive world, which has been faithfully recreated using LEGO. Much like the remaster, this game will also be available on PC, as well as on Nintendo Switch. Although it hasn't got a release date yet, the game is officially open for pre-order. It's reported that LEGO Horizon Adventures will be released on November 14, but Guerilla Games hasn't yet confirmed the date.

Compared to previous remasters developed for PlayStation, Horizon comes as a general shock to the audience, as it was only released in 2017 and looked pretty good, all things considered. Whether this now means that Horizon Forbidden West will equally get a remaster coming up soon remains to be seen, but it wouldn't be that surprising. The Last of Us received two remasters, with The Last of Us Part 2 also getting its own remaster, despite only being released in 2020. Although technology advances constantly, technology for creating a game like The Last of Us 2 hasn't evolved that much, and it seemed very unnecessary to make a remaster of a game that was still looking brand-new and up to date compared to other IPs that PlayStation fans have been asking for for years now. These IPs include Bloodborne for PC, Demon's Souls for PC, and remakes of games such as Parasite Eve and Dino Crisis (which was added to the PlayStation Plus catalog for October.)

item.title: Ghost Of Yōtei Looks Like Exactly The Game PS5 Pro Needs To Show Off Its Power
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/ps5-pro-ghost-of-tsushima-2-yotei-sequel-state-of-play-1851656738

During September 24's Sony State of Play, Sucker Punch revealed the long-awaited first trailer for its Ghost of Tsushima sequel. And boy howdy, it sure does look pretty.

Ghost of Yōtei is the name of the newly revealed sequel and it’s set in a different part of Japan, a few hundred years after the events of the first game, and stars a new character, Atsu. We don’t know much more about the story, but Sucker Punch did make it clear in a blog post published after the reveal that it “wanted to explore what it could mean to have a new hero wearing a Ghost mask, and uncovering a new legend.” The setting, according to the blog post, is the year 1603, in “the lands surrounding Mount Yōtei” in the region of Japan that today is known as Hokkaido. That’s all we really know about the story and world of this sequel.

Looking at the new 4K trailer posted by Sony, it really feels like Ghost of Yōtei was designed not only to showcase the power of the PS5, but also to show off the newly announced $700 PS5 Pro. It’s shocking to me that Sony didn’t include this game in the PS5 Pro announcement, even as a tiny teaser, to show off something totally new and amazing looking, running on the pricey console.

According to Sucker Punch, this is the first game they’ve built from “the ground up” for PS5. And I expect Ghost of Yōtei will take full advantage of the PS5 Pro. Here’s what Sucker Punch had to say about working on the PS5.

This is also Sucker Punch’s first game built from the ground up for PlayStation 5, and we’re excited to build on the visual foundation we established in Ghost of Tsushima by making the world feel even more real. We have massive sightlines that let you look far across the environment, whole new skies featuring twinkling stars and auroras, even more believable movement from wind on grass and vegetation, and more improvements we’ll share in the future. Our new setting also gives us the opportunity to introduce new mechanics, gameplay improvements, and even new weapons.

And now, let’s look at some pretty screenshots of this gorgeous-looking game, which is set to launch sometime in 2025.

Here’s the new trailer, showcasing various environments, monsters, and talking bipedal humanoid cats. (That’s just part of the franchise, okay? It’s not weird at all.)

First announced back in December 2023 during the Game Awards, Monster Hunter Wilds is the big new sequel to 2018's Monster Hunter World. That previous game went on to become Capcom’s best-selling video game of all time. So there are a lot of people excited to get their hands on this next mainline installment in the monster-killing franchise. And luckily, the wait is almost over. Capcom confirmed today that Monster Hunter Wilds is releasing on February 28, 2025.

In the game’s fourth trailer at State Of Play, Cacpom revealed Monster Hunter Wilds’ “flagship monster,” the Arkveld. Here’s what Capcom had to say about this new monster in a PlayStation Blog post:

A Hunter on a Seikret and Olivia, a member of the Research Commission stand face-to-face with a mysterious new threat that lies at the center of the story, Arkveld. [It’s a] monster from a long extinct species, shrouded in mystery. It bears uniquely shaped, chain-like wings.

Pre-orders for Monster Hunter Wilds go live today. Players who pre-order will get access to the “Guild Knight Set” and the Talisman “Hope Charm.” Capcom also says that anyone who pre-orders the downloadable version from the PlayStation Store will receive a Monster Hunter Wilds digital art book. This is apparently a PlayStation store exclusive and will function as a separate app on your PS5. Sounds a bit clunky, but hey, art is nice to look at.
